fma
hub_float fma(
const 
hub_float& 
a,
const 
hub_float& 
b,
const 
hub_float& 
c
)

Fused multiply-add function for hub_float.  Computes (a*b + c) with only one rounding operation using hardware FMA.

Parameters
a
const hub_float&

The first hub_float to multiply.

b
const hub_float&

The second hub_float to multiply.

c
const hub_float&

The hub_float to add to the product.

Returns

The result of (a*b + c) as a hub_float.

Notes

When emulating float32 (EXP_BITS=8, MANT_BITS=23), hardware FMA operates in double precision, which can lead to double rounding.  This function includes special logic to detect and correct such cases by adjusting the result by one ULP when necessary, ensuring accurate single-precision rounding.

operator"" _hb
hub_float operator"" _hb(
long 
double 
d
)

User-defined literal for creating a `hub_float` from a literal value with `_hb` suffix.

Parameters
d
long double

The long double literal value being converted into `hub`.

Return An equivalent `Hub_Float` instance
